issue.title: Walking controller stability decreases as real time factor decreases

content.raw: Would it make sense to fix the controller as well?  Even at a real time factor of 0.5 the knee oscillation is present on simple steps, but not as critical.  It seems that the overall system would be more robust if the controller worked at low real time factors as well as at higher real time factors.
content.html: Would it make sense to fix the controller as well? Even at a real time factor of 0.5 the knee oscillation is present on simple steps, but not as critical. It seems that the overall system would be more robust if the controller worked at low real time factors as well as at higher real time factors.
